info.description: This is the Nexodus API Server.

parameters.name: prefix

get.description: Lists all Security Groups in a VPC

get.description: Checks if the user is currently authenticated
gets the jwks that can be used to verify JWTs created by this server.
Retrieves the claims present in the user's access token.
Handles the callback from the OAuth2/OpenID provider and verifies the tokens.

parameters.description: state value from the login start request
parameters.name: state

302.description: Redirects to the URLs specified in the login start request

get.description: Generates state and nonce, then redirects the user to the OAuth2 authorization URL.

parameters.description: URL to redirect to if login succeeds
parameters.name: redirect

parameters.description: URL to redirect to if login fails (optional)
parameters.name: failure

302.description: Redirects to the OAuth2 authorization URL

get.description: Provides the URL to initiate the logout process for the current user.

parameters.description: URL to redirect to after logout
parameters.name: redirect

302.description: Redirects to the OAuth2 logout URL

post.description: Obtains and updates a new access token for the user.

get.description: Fetches and returns information for the user who is currently authenticated.

email.description: The email address of the user to invite (one of email or user_id is required)

user_id.description: The user id to invite (one of email or user_id is required)

expires_at.description: ExpiresAt is optional, if set the registration key is only valid until the ExpiresAt time.

security_group_id.description: SecurityGroupId is the ID of the security group to assign to the device.

service_network_id.description: ServiceNetworkID is the ID of the Service Network the device can join.

settings.description: Settings contains general settings for the device.

single_use.description: SingleUse only allows the registration key to be used once.

vpc_id.description: VpcID is the ID of the VPC the device will join.

duration.description:
Requested 'duration' (i.e. lifetime) of the Certificate. Note that the
issuer may choose to ignore the requested duration, just like any other
requested attribute.
+optional

is_ca.description:
Requested basic constraints isCA value. Note that the issuer may choose
to ignore the requested isCA value, just like any other requested attribute.

NOTE: If the CSR in the `Request` field has a BasicConstraints extension,
it must have the same isCA value as specified here.

If true, this will automatically add the `cert sign` usage to the list
of requested `usages`.
+optional

request.description:
The PEM-encoded X.509 certificate signing request to be submitted to the
issuer for signing.

If the CSR has a BasicConstraints extension, its isCA attribute must
match the `isCA` value of this CertificateRequest.
If the CSR has a KeyUsage extension, its key usages must match the
key usages in the `usages` field of this CertificateRequest.
If the CSR has a ExtKeyUsage extension, its extended key usages
must match the extended key usages in the `usages` field of this
CertificateRequest.

usages.description:
Requested key usages and extended key usages.

NOTE: If the CSR in the `Request` field has uses the KeyUsage or
ExtKeyUsage extension, these extensions must have the same values
as specified here without any additional values.

If unset, defaults to `digital signature` and `key encipherment`.
+optional

ca.description:
The PEM encoded X.509 certificate of the signer, also known as the CA
(Certificate Authority).
This is set on a best-effort basis by different issuers.
If not set, the CA is assumed to be unknown/not available.
+optional

certificate.description:
The PEM encoded X.509 certificate resulting from the certificate
signing request.
If not set, the CertificateRequest has either not been completed or has
failed. More information on failure can be found by checking the
`conditions` field.
+optional

bearer_token.description: the token nexd should use to reconcile device state.

device_authorization_endpoint.description:
TODO: Remove this once golang/oauth2 supports device flow
and when coreos/go-oidc adds device_authorization_endpoint discovery

server_time.description:
the current time on the server, can be used by a client to get an idea of what the time skew is
in relation to the server.

address.description: IP address and port of the endpoint.

bearer_token.description: BearerToken is the bearer token the client should use to authenticate the device registration request.

device_id.description: DeviceId is set if the RegKey was created for single use

expires_at.description: ExpiresAt is optional, if set the registration key is only valid until the ExpiresAt time.

owner_id.description: OwnerID is the ID of the user that created the registration key.

security_group_id.description: SecurityGroupId is the ID of the security group to assign to the device.

service_network_id.description: ServiceNetworkID is the ID of the Service Network the device can join.

settings.description: Settings contains general settings for the device.

vpc_id.description: VpcID is the ID of the VPC the device can join.

bearer_token.description: the token nexd should use to reconcile Site state.

address.description: IP address and port of the endpoint.

cidr.description: VPC CIDR this address was allocated from

expires_at.description: ExpiresAt is optional, if set the registration key is only valid until the ExpiresAt time.

security_group_id.description: SecurityGroupId is the ID of the security group to assign to the device.

settings.description: Settings contains general settings for the device.

scopes.admin: Grants read and write access to administrative information
scopes.user: Grants read and write access to resources owned by this user

tags.description: X509 Certificate related APIs, these APIs are experimental and disabled by default.  Use the feature flag apis to check if they are enabled on the server.
tags.name: CA

tags.description: Skupper Site related APIs, these APIs are experimental and disabled by default.  Use the feature flag apis to check if they are enabled on the server.
tags.name: Sites
